thread.title: The best of the London Bike Show 2017 – Gallery
thread.title_full: The best of the London Bike Show 2017 – Gallery

title: The best of the London Bike Show 2017 – Gallery
text: The best of the London Bike Show 2017 – Gallery Road highlights from the UK’s largest cycling exhibition 1 / 65   Campagnolo rear derailleur (Josh Evans/Immediate) It wasn't just Italian bikes on show (Josh Evans/Immediate) The brakes can be accessed from the outside of the forks (Josh Evans/Immediate) LOOK also had a fork integrated front brake system (Josh Evans/Immediate) The bike features a LOOK Zed3 crankset (Josh Evans/Immediate) The LOOK 796 time trial bike (Josh Evans/Immediate) A look at the P5X aero profile (Josh Evans/Immediate) The frameset design provides both aerodynamics and comfort (Josh Evans/Immediate) The bottom bracket area is equipped with storage space (Josh Evans/Immediate) A MTN-Qhubeka edition Cervelo S5 (Josh Evans/Immediate) The Team WIGGINS bikes are equipped with SRAM Red eTap groupsets (Josh Evans/Immediate) Pinarello's in-house component brand Most provide the saddle (Josh Evans/Immediate) The Team WIGGINS Dogma F10 rear end (Josh Evans/Immediate) A familiar design from the late nineties, reproduced on a Cannondale SuperSix Evo (Josh Evans/Immediate) The Vitus is equipped with Campagnolo gearing (Josh Evans/Immediate) The unqiue design from the Canyon-SRAM team bikes (Josh Evans/Immediate) 21 / 65 Marcel Kittel and Tom Boonen have already won the the S-Works Venge ViAS disc this season (Josh Evans/Immediate) 22 / 65 The Ridley Noah SL features air vents in the forks to improve airflow around the bike (Josh Evans/Immediate)   seat cluster on Aqua Blue's bikes (Josh Evans/Immediate) The Knight Composite wheels are paired with Schwalbe tyres and golden shamrocks (Josh Evans/Immediate) The bikes are equipped with Shimano Dura-Ace groupsets (Josh Evans/Immediate) Aqua Blue Sport's Ridley Noah SL (Josh Evans/Immediate) A Bloc Beer have repurposed an old Peugeot team car (Josh Evans/Immediate) A close look at the Canyon Speedmax (Josh Evans/Immediate) Alejandro Valverde's Canyon Ultimate CF SLX (Josh Evans/Immediate) Internal cable routing on the SuperSix Evo (Josh Evans/Immediate) The Spinergy wheels are paired with Vittoria Corsa tyres (Josh Evans/Immediate)   design details (Josh Evans/Immediate) The Team WIGGINS Pinarello Dogma F10 (Josh Evans/Immediate) Shimano Dura-Ace 9150 Di2 shifters (Josh Evans/Immediate)
